trustfund: TF020935-PRIVATE SECTOR DEVELOPMENT,TF020460-NORWEGIAN CONSULTANTS TRUST FUND

abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is satisfactory, and
            sustainability is likely. However, the overall borrower
            performance is rated unsatisfactory, because of lack of
            Government commitments to private sector development, and of
            inadequate funding, and lack of leadership during project
            implementation. Lessons convey that technical assistance
            projects should not be considered substitutes to weak
            Government commitment, instead, a shared, and strategic
            vision among stakeholders, and an active involvement of the
            private sector should take place during all stages of the
            project. The institutional framework changes needed to prod
            private sector development, were hindered by such lack of
            commitment, rather, emphasis should have been on capacity
            building as an incremental, and long-term process, that
            requires motivation for change in recipient institutions.
            This indicates the need for a close donor coordination,
            between the Bank and interested donors to support Government
            programs, essential particularly since Burkina Faso is
            highly dependent on external assistance. It is further
            suggested that during implementation, special conditions for
            credit effectiveness should be avoided, to be made instead a
            condition of negotiations, if critical to the success of the
            project; and, during supervision, close attention of Bank
            management is essential. Nonetheless, the competitiveness
            study proved instrumental in laying the foundation for a
            reform program.
